title: Cohesive teal tokens across Tailwind + updated bottom-justified hero image

requirements.summary: Standardize global color tokens so Tailwind utilities (text/bg/border/ring for secondary + accent) consistently resolve to teal in light/dark, removing conflicting variable sources.
acceptanceCriteria: Using `text-secondary`, `bg-secondary`, `border-secondary`, and `ring-secondary` produces teal styling (not default black/white/gray) in both light and dark mode.
No component requires hard-coded color values to achieve teal accents; tokens/variables drive the styling.
Global CSS variables are not defined in multiple conflicting places such that one overrides/breaks the other.

file_operations.description: Align Tailwind theme color token mappings to a single color space approach so utilities like `text-secondary`, `bg-secondary`, `border-secondary`, `ring-secondary`, and `bg-accent` correctly interpret CSS variables (e.g., avoid mixing `hsl(var(--...))` with OKLCH-wrapped variables).

Normalize `:root` and `.dark` design tokens so `--secondary`, `--accent`, etc. are defined in a Tailwind-compatible format (no nested `oklch(oklch(...))`), ensure ring/border/input tokens support teal focus states, and update any teal glow utilities to derive from tokens rather than hard-coded color values.
Remove the duplicate global CSS variable definition file to eliminate conflicting/duplicate token sources, keeping `frontend/src/index.css` as the single source of truth for global tokens.

requirements.summary: Apply teal accents consistently via tokens/Tailwind classes for the logo/wordmark, non-semantic Lucide icons, and button variants (including outline/secondary) without changing behavior or adding components.
acceptanceCriteria: Header brand area (icon + “Whisper” wordmark) clearly renders with teal accents.
Non-semantic Lucide icons across key interactive areas inherit teal styling via `text-secondary` (or equivalent token usage) instead of rendering as default black/white.
Secondary/outline buttons consistently use teal for border/text/hover/focus ring states and do not fall back to non-teal colors.

file_operations.description: Replace hard-coded teal/brand color usages (e.g., arbitrary `oklch(...)`/`rgba(...)` shadows and accent colors) with token-driven Tailwind utilities (`text-secondary`, `bg-secondary`, `border-secondary`, `ring-secondary`, `bg-accent`, etc.) to ensure consistent teal styling for the header brand, interactive icons, and outline/secondary buttons while preserving existing layout and behavior.
Ensure the primary Secretary CTA button and associated Lucide icon styling rely on teal tokens (`secondary`/`accent`) for consistent appearance across themes (styling-only; no behavior changes).

Ensure key interactive icons/buttons (menu, send, selectable options) consistently inherit teal styling through `text-secondary`/`border-secondary`/`ring-secondary` token utilities and remove any remaining non-token teal color definitions (styling-only).

requirements.summary: Update the hero background to the new image and set background positioning to bottom-justified while keeping overlay/text readability intact.
acceptanceCriteria: The hero section uses the provided image as the background.
The background image is bottom-justified on common viewport sizes (mobile/desktop).
Hero text remains readable against the overlay (no contrast regressions).

file_operations.description: Update the hero background image reference to the new local static asset and adjust the hero background positioning to bottom-justified (e.g., center bottom) while preserving the existing overlay and text styling for readability.

requirements.summary: Add the new hero image as a static frontend asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference it locally (no remote URL at runtime).
acceptanceCriteria: A new static hero image file exists under `frontend/public/assets/generated/`.
The hero section references the local static asset path (not the remote Basecamp URL at runtime).

file_operations.description: Add the generated hero background photo asset at the exact path `frontend/public/assets/generated/whisper-hero-community-collab.dim_2400x1350.jpg` for local runtime use.

Ensure the hero section references the local static asset `frontend/public/assets/generated/whisper-hero-community-collab.dim_2400x1350.jpg` (and not the remote Basecamp URL) when setting the hero background image.
